title: A Phase 3, Randomized, Double-Blind, Placebo-Controlled, Parallel Group Study to Evaluate the Safety and Efficacy of KarXT + KarX-EC for the Treatment of Agitation Associated With Alzheimer's Disease
description_brief: The purpose of this study is to evaluate the efficacy and safety of KarXT + KarX-EC in adult participants with agitation related to Alzheimer's Disease.

Act (intervention details): KarXT is a combination of xanomeline (a centrally active M1/M4-preferring muscarinic receptor agonist) plus trospium chloride (a peripherally restricted muscarinic antagonist) intended to retain central effects while reducing peripheral cholinergic adverse events. KarX-EC refers to an enteric formulation of xanomeline. These descriptions are used in KarXT clinical publications and trial listings. citeturn0search5turn0search9turn0search0
